ratings.question_text: Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: Out of class homework, out of class speaking assignments.

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I furthered my knowledge of the Spanish language and furthered my knowledge of Spanish speaking culture.
Basic spanish speaking skills, beginner-intermediate spanish reading and listening skills.
I learned how to absorb material from the textbook and be able to use what I learned there in class.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I thought this class was taught well for online. All of my improvements would deal with how this class was not at its full potential being taught online.

The strength of the course was that we were able to cover a great amount of material in a relatively short amount of time. The weaknesses of the course was that we were responsible for memorizing a lot of vocabulary and grammar rules while also having a large amount of homework each night, making it very challenging to both study the material we learned while also completing the work expected of us daily. Additionally, we were responsible for topics covered in the textbook and expected to understand these topics and answer questions about them in class without learning much about them in class. We also started speaking mostly Spanish during class very quickly. It was often hard to understand what the teacher was saying, making it hard to know what was asked of us so early on. Additionally, having test instructions in Spanish was challenging because it was often hard to know what was being expected of us on each assessment.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I thought that in class discussions worked well, but the speaking assignments were iffy. I would have had us perform them in class/person.

The teacher succeeded in keeping each student engaged and involved in each class as we all had to speak often. An improvement would be to spend more time having conversations and practicing in a way where everyone could be involved without feeling put on the spot.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I would because Spanish is a great language and this course provides an avenue for learning it.
Yes, very good class, especially with Maria Vazquez. Workload isn't terrible and it's an engaging class.

I would only recommend this course to a student very interested in learning Spanish, otherwise I would recommend that take a different language with a less great workload, as we had to do work every night that took a long time that felt unnecessary.
